segments.text: No , it hasn't . It's very dirty .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Someone ought to clean it today .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Mark should clean it . It's his turn .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , he cleaned it last time . It's your turn .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , it isn't . You always clean it after Mark .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh dear , is it really my turn ? In that case , I'll clean tomorrow .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Clean it now . Only lazy people say they'll work tomorrow .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Then I'll clean it the day after tomorrow .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You are lazy . You ought to be ashamed ? You should enjoy working .
segments.speaker: S1
